results.title: Surfing waves
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and John Davis
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the action and properties of waves. Aerial views of the seacoast are used to show diffraction and refraction of parallel wave fronts and laboratory examples further exemplify this point. The action of convergent and divergent lens systems is also demonstrated. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Demonstrates the action and properties of waves. results.title: Surface tension
results.brief_description: Reviews the nature and shows some applications of surface tension: comparison of solids, gases and liquids with reference to size and shape; demonstration of how the surface of water behaves like an elastic skin; effect of modifying the surface by addition of camphor, ether and soap; surface tension seen in films and bubbles; capillary action; applications including blotting paper, lamp wick, candle, paint brush and killing of mosquito larvae.

results.title: Surface chemistry
results.creator_credit: Brandon Films, Nobel Films, Edmund Lawrence Dorfman and John Gilmour
results.brief_description: Dr Irving Langmuir, Nobel prize winner, describes some of the experiments in surface chemistry which shed light on the properties of the molecule.

results.title: Surf sail
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Tom Williamson and Sam Neill
results.brief_description: Cook Strait, which separates the North and South Islands of New Zealand, is one of the most dangerous stretches of water in the world. Three people attempt to cross the Strait, with its unpredictable conditions, tides and currents, on wind surfboards.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Zealand National Film Unit, Tom Williamson and Sam Neill

results.title: Surf beach [Italian Version]
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Bern Gandy
results.brief_description: The hundreds of thousands of Australian who visit the beach each summer seldom realise that ceaseless work is required to keep the beach clean and safe. This film shows the activities of those who work to protect swimmers and guarantee their enjoyment of the beach. NB: In Italian with no English subtitles.

results.title: Surf beach [Greek version]
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Bern Gandy
results.brief_description: The hundreds of thousands of Australians whovisit the beach each summer seldom realise that ceaseless work is required to keep the beach clean andsafe. results.title: Sure thing
results.creator_credit: Jacquelin Perske, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Knowing their aspirations will come true is what separates teenage friends Narelle and Nancy from other dreamers. Together, they are going to make it big as a singer and a writer and get out of their current situation - high school, Melbourne, and move to America. All it takes is money. As the girls slip in and out of fantasy, reality becomes all the more unbearable as their parents try to separate them. Cast includes Louise Fox and Di Adams.

results.title: Surcouf
results.creator_credit: Georges de la Giraudiere and Roy Rowland
results.brief_description:
The first of two films (in our collection) recounting the exploits of famous privateer Robert Surcouf and starring Gerard Barray. On 6 October 1801, in the Sea of Bengal, Surcouf and his crew attack the English vessel ‘Kent’. See also: Le Retour de Surcouf (X000345, 16mm).

Credits: Producer, Georges de la Giraudiere ; director, Roy Rowland ; photography, Juan Gelpi.
Cast: Gerard Barray, Antonella Lualdi, Genevieve Casile, Terrence Morgan.

results.title: Sur mer et sur terre etc.
results.brief_description: Five French language programmes taken in location in and arround Fecamp and Potiers: 1. “Sur mer et sur terre”. 2. “Par les rues”. 3. “Chemin faisant”. 4. “Ecole, travail, familie”. 5. Loisirs”.

results.title: Sur le pont d'Avignon
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Wolf Koenig and Jean-Paul Ladouceur
results.brief_description: Extravagantly gowned marionettes perform the pantomimes in this old French folksong, with vocal interpretations by the Trio Lyrique.
